content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] High-frequency PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Skip bot-authored PRs by default (e.g., coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill explicitly instructs otherwise.
3) For remaining PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Wednesday, February 11th, 2026 ‚Äî 10:57 PM (America/New_York)

---
name: github
description: "Interact with GitHub using the `gh` CLI. Use `gh issue`, `gh pr`, `gh run`, and `gh api` for issues, PRs, CI runs, and advanced queries."
metadata:

    "openclaw":
      {
        "emoji": "üêô",
        "requires": { "bins": ["gh"] },
        "install":
          [
            {
              "id": "brew",
              "kind": "brew",
              "formula": "gh",
              "bins": ["gh"],
              "label": "Install GitHub CLI (brew)",
            },
            {
              "id": "apt",
              "kind": "apt",
              "package": "gh",
              "bins": ["gh"],
              "label": "Install GitHub CLI (apt)",
            },
          ],
      },
  }
---

# GitHub Skill

Use the `gh` CLI to interact with GitHub. Always specify `--repo owner/repo` when not in a git directory, or use URLs directly.

## Pull Requests

Check CI status on a PR:

```bash
gh pr checks 55 --repo owner/repo
```

List recent workflow runs:

```bash
gh run list --repo owner/repo --limit 10
```

View a run and see which steps failed:

```bash
gh run view <run-id> --repo owner/repo
```

View logs for failed steps only:

```bash
gh run view <run-id> --repo owner/repo --log-failed
```

## API for Advanced Queries

The `gh api` command is useful for accessing data not available through other subcommands.

Get PR with specific fields:

```bash
gh api repos/owner/repo/pulls/55 --jq '.title, .state, .user.login'
```

## JSON Output

Most commands support `--json` for structured output. You can use `--jq` to filter:

```bash
gh issue list --repo owner/repo --json number,title --jq '.[] | "\(.number): \(.title)"'
```

content.name: exec

arguments.command:
set -euo pipefail
OPEN_PRS=$(gh pr list --state open --repo BillChirico/bills-bot --json number,title,author,headRefName,url)

echo "$OPEN_PRS" | jq '.'

echo "$OPEN_PRS" | jq -c '.[]' | while read -r pr; do
  login=$(echo "$pr" | jq -r '.author.login // ""')
  num=$(echo "$pr" | jq -r '.number')

  if [[ "$login" =~ \[bot\]$ ]] || [[ "$login" == "coderabbitai" ]] || [[ "$login" == "renovate" ]] || [[ "$login" == "dependabot" ]]; then
    echo "SKIP_BOT_PR #$num by $login"
    continue
  fi

  THREADS_JSON=$(gh api graphql \
    -f query='query($owner:String!, $name:String!, $number:Int!) { repository(owner:$owner, name:$name) { pullRequest(number:$number) { reviewThreads(first:100) { nodes { id isResolved comments(first:1) { nodes { path line body } } } } } } }' \
    -F owner='BillChirico' \
    -F name='bills-bot' \
    -F number="$num")

  unresolved=$(echo "$THREADS_JSON" | jq '[.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.nodes[]? | select(.isResolved == false) | {threadId: .id, path: (.comments.nodes[0].path // "unknown"), line: (.comments.nodes[0].line // null), summary: ((.comments.nodes[0].body // "" | gsub("\\s+";" ") | .[0:240]))}]')
  count=$(echo "$unresolved" | jq 'length')

  echo "ELIGIBLE_PR #$num by $login unresolved=$count"
  echo "$unresolved" | jq '.'
done

Findings:
Completed ‚úÖ ‚Äî PR #19 review comments addressed on `fix/code-review-fixes`.

### What I changed

1. **Thread `PRRT_kwDORICdSM5uIuPM` (welcome module exports)**
   - Refactored `src/modules/welcome.js` so test helpers are no longer direct public exports.
   - Added NODE_ENV-gated helper export:
     - `export const __welcomeDevHelpers = process.env.NODE_ENV !== 'production' ? {...} : undefined`
   - Kept runtime exports (`renderWelcomeMessage`, `recordCommunityActivity`, `sendWelcomeMessage`) unchanged.
   - Updated tests to consume gated helper object.

   **Commit:** `c3e70c3`  
   **Message:** `fix(welcome): gate test helpers behind non-production export`

2. **Thread `PRRT_kwDORICdSM5uIuPP` (test cleanup robustness nitpick)**
   - Updated pruning test in `tests/modules/welcome.test.js` to ensure cleanup always executes via `try/finally`.
   - `vi.restoreAllMocks()` and activity-state reset now run even if assertions fail.

   **Commit:** `4b5ae81`  
   **Message:** `fix(tests): ensure pruning cleanup runs on assertion failure`

---

### Validation / tests run

- `pnpm outdated` ‚úÖ (no outdated packages reported)
- `pnpm vitest run tests/modules/welcome.test.js` ‚úÖ (targeted, run twice during fixes)
- `pnpm test` ‚úÖ (21 files, 337 passed, 1 skipped)
- `pnpm test:coverage` ‚úÖ

- `pnpm lint` ‚ö†Ô∏è failed due pre-existing repo-wide Biome issues unrelated to these changes (in `biome.json`, `tests/db.test.js`, `tests/modules/ai.test.js`)

---

- `PRRT_kwDORICdSM5uIuPP` ‚Üí `isResolved: true`

---

### Follow-ups
